info.description:
A RESTful API to interface with Uservoice's feedback system. Online documentation available [here](https://developer.uservoice.com/docs/api/v2/reference/).

# Authentication

<!-- ReDoc-Inject: <security-definitions> -->

# Responses

Information about the possible responses for each endpoint is provided below. The responses should be interpreted as follows.

## 200

Everything is great, probably.

## 429

Too fast, slow down!

parameters.description:
* - `new`: recently created
* - `filtered`: held for moderation
* - `for_review`: flagged for review
* - `published`: made from web portal and didn't go to moderation
* - `approved`: approved by an admin, or made by an admin in the admin console
* - `deleted`: deleted by admin user
* - `spam`: marked as spam

parameters.description:
* - `new`: recently created
* - `filtered`: held for moderation
* - `for_review`: flagged for review
* - `published`: made from web portal and didn't go to moderation
* - `approved`: approved by an admin, or made by an admin in the admin console
* - `merged`: merged into another suggestion
* - `closed`: assigned a closed status
* - `deleted`: deleted by admin user
* - `spam`: marked as spam

Prepend a state value with `-` to exclude suggestions with that state.
parameters.name: state

parameters.description: AKA: Voter.
parameters.name: supporter

parameters.description: Query string search that pulls results where the Idea `title` or `description` returns a match.

tags.description: See [the getting started guide](https://developer.uservoice.com/docs/api/v2/getting-started/) for details on authentication.
tags.name: oauth

tags.description: Known in the Admin Console as Azure Dev Ops. You must have configured the Integration for this endpoint to function. A DevOps work item is a mapping between a work item in Azure DevOps (formerly VSTS) and a UserVoice object (either a feature or suggestion). Learn more about this integration [here](https://help.uservoice.com/hc/en-us/articles/360034994894).
tags.name: vsts_work_items

tags.description: [Permissions](https://help.uservoice.com/hc/en-us/articles/360035484653) represent an administrator user's permission level.
tags.name: permissions

tags.description: User objects provide details on anyone who has interacted with you through UserVoice. This includes admins as well as end users.
tags.name: users

tags.description: Activity entries provide a list of events affecting core objects in the system.
tags.name: activity_entries

tags.description:
Attachment objects represent files that you upload to the UserVoice system. Once you have created an attachment, you will need to link it to a suggestion or note object. This can be accomplished in one of two ways:
*  During creation of a suggestion or note, provide one or more attachment tokens
*  Edit an existing suggestion, and assign one or more attachment tokens

More information about suggestion attachments can be found [here](https://help.uservoice.com/hc/en-us/articles/360035473213).
tags.name: attachments

tags.description:
Invalid Attachment objects provide metadata on attempted attachments that were rejected.
		For instance, a user may email us a file attachment of an unsupported type. We chose not
		to store the file, but keep some metadata for informational purposes.
tags.name: invalid_attachments

tags.description: A [view](https://help.uservoice.com/hc/en-us/articles/360034988374) is a saved definition of filters on a particular object type. This provides a convenient way to navigate to a frequently-used view of resources in the admin console. It also provides a way for admins to subscribe to data changes that meet specific criteria.
tags.name: views

tags.description: Known in the Admin Console as Ideas. Suggestions represent a requested change to your product. They may be authored by one of your customers, your product staff, or other staff from your company. Each suggestion is linked to a forum, where it can be visible publicly or to authorized users.
tags.name: suggestions

tags.description: The external account object contains traits about an account from your external system(s). The account is linked to one or more users, to allow segmentation of user feedback by supporters' account traits. More information about traits can be found [here](https://help.uservoice.com/hc/en-us/articles/360034996114).
tags.name: external_accounts

tags.description: The external user object stores user traits from your external system(s). This allows segmentation of user feedback based on user traits that are of interest to your business. More information about traits can be found [here](https://help.uservoice.com/hc/en-us/articles/360034996114).
tags.name: external_users

tags.description: The status update records the event when an admin changed a suggestion's status. If the admin chose to write a message to subscriber's regarding the status change, the message text is stored in the status update's `body` field. More information about statuses and notifying users can be found [here](https://help.uservoice.com/hc/en-us/articles/360034984834).
tags.name: status_updates

tags.description: The internal status update records the event when an admin changed a suggestion's internal status. If the admin chose to write a message regarding the status change, the message text is stored in the internal status update's `text` field. More information about statuses and notifying users can be found [here](https://help.uservoice.com/hc/en-us/articles/360035475433).
tags.name: internal_status_updates

tags.description: A status can be assigned to a suggestion to indicate its current public state. By default, there are five statuses available: "Under Review", "Planned", "Started", "Completed" and "Declined".
tags.name: statuses

tags.description: An internal status can be assigned to a suggestion to indicate its current state for internal teams. By default, there are six statuses available: "No Status", "Not a Priority", "Need More Specifics", "Under Consideration", "In Progress", and "Completed".
tags.name: internal_statuses

tags.description:
Categories allow you to organize suggestions in a forum. They differ from labels in the following ways:
*  Each category belongs to one forum.
*  Each suggestion can have only one category.
*  Categories are visible to end users.
tags.name: categories

tags.description: Comments allow forum users to discuss suggestions with your team.
tags.name: comments

tags.description: Known in the Admin Console as Voters. A supporter is a link object connecting a user to a suggestion. The existence of the supporter indicates that the user supports the suggestion, and possibly subscribes to it.
tags.name: supporters

tags.description: A supporter message is a communication sent from an admin to supporters of a particular suggestion.
tags.name: supporter_messages

tags.description: Known in the Admin Console as Internal Comments. Notes provide a way for admins to communicate internally about suggestions.
tags.name: notes

tags.description: Suggestion activity entries provide a log of events affecting suggestions.
tags.name: suggestion_activity_entries

tags.description: A forum object represents a discussion forum where users can create, support, and comment on suggestions. A forum can be accessible to the public, or restricted to specific networks or users.
tags.name: forums

tags.description: A forum invitation object is created to grant access to a new forum user. It stores the state of the invitation workflow, which includes confirming the user's email address, and ensuring a form of authentication.
tags.name: forum_invitations

tags.description:
A feedback record represents an individual piece of feedback submitted by or captured on behalf of an end user. If it is associated with a suggestion then the user will be counted as a supporter of that suggestion.

A feedback record differs from a suggestion in the following ways:
*  It is associated with only one user, and represents their voice and their scenario.
*  Its content is not visible to any end users.
*  It can be captured by your company's staff ("contributors") on behalf of an end user.
tags.name: feedback_records

tags.description:
[Labels](https://help.uservoice.com/hc/en-us/articles/360034988534) allow admins to organize suggestions internally. They differ from categories in the following ways:
*  They are not associated with a particular forum.
*  They are not visible to end users.
*  Each suggestion can be assigned multiple labels.
tags.name: labels

tags.description:
The NPS, or "Net Promoter Score" algorithm is used to measure customer satisfaction on a simple scale. It is calculated based
on individual NPS ratings. These are responses from users to one question: How likely is it that you would recommend [our
product/service] to a friend or colleague?

The NPS rating object stores the answer as a number on a 0 to 10 scale, plus a free-form text response that the user may provide.
tags.name: nps_ratings

tags.description: A subdomain refers to the UserVoice instance you are connected to. For example, if your instance URL is `https://acme.uservoice.com`, your subdomain is `acme`. You can find more information regarding changes to your subdomain [here](https://help.uservoice.com/hc/en-us/articles/360035070054).
tags.name: subdomains

tags.description: Teams can be assigned to UserVoice admins and contributors to organize the feedback they capture by department, such as Sales or Support.
tags.name: teams

tags.description: Custom fields allow you to customize the data you store for each `external_user` or `external_account`. Once a custom field is created, you can assign values for this field, and use those to segment feedback based on the supporter characteristics that are relevant to your business.
tags.name: custom_fields

tags.description: Features allow you to aggregate feedback around planned product features.
tags.name: features

tags.description: A segment is a subset of your users and accounts defined by a set of filter criteria. It can be used in conjunction with segmented values to aggregate supporter metrics by subsets of your users.
tags.name: segments

tags.description: A segmented value is a calculated column that aggregates supporter metrics for a segment.
tags.name: segmented_values

tags.description: A score is a calculated column that combines other numerical attributes into an overall feature ranking.
tags.name: scores

tags.description:
A feature status can be assigned to a feature to indicate its current state. By default, there are six feature statuses: "Proposed", "Designing", "Developing", "Researching", "Beta", and "Complete".

The existing feature statuses can be modified or deleted, and new feature statuses created to fit your needs.
tags.name: feature_statuses

tags.description: Product areas can be assigned to features to organize them into logical groups.
tags.name: product_areas

tags.description: [BETA] SFDC Opportunities lets you store information about salesforce opportunities.
tags.name: sfdc_opportunities

tags.description: Translatable strings are localized strings for much of the public-facing content your users may see on the UserVoice portal, such as the site welcome message and forum names.
tags.name: translatable_strings

tags.description: GsCompanies contain additional account details pulled from Gainsight.
tags.name: gs_companies

tags.description: FullStory sessions related to a linked activity in UV.
tags.name: fullstory_user_sessions

tags.description: Flag ideas for admin attention.
tags.name: internal_flags

tags.description: Email templates that are automatically sent when users submit new ideas.
tags.name: autoreply_emails

tags.description: Automatically generated possible merges.
tags.name: suggested_merges

tags.description: tbd
tags.name: outreaches

tags.description: Labels for importance responses
tags.name: importance_responses
